p: In contrast to our results, two studies showed that S. indica colonized herbs, such as fennel and Thymus vulgaris, harbor higher amounts of essential oil ( Dolatabadi et al., 2011a, b). As we mentioned above, the effects of S. indica are very host dependent. Our results indicate that S. indica might not be suitable to increase the essential oil content in sweet basil. In fact, S. indica decreased the eugenol concentration.
